intro: Scopolia lucida, commonly known as the white hellebore, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae and is characterized by its showy, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant has large, palmately lobed leaves that are often covered in a waxy coating. Scopolia lucida contains toxic alkaloids, making it potentially harmful if ingested. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in woodland areas.
